content:
I don't have personal experiences or feelings, but here are some suggestions for international students on how they can gain experience in their field of study if they are unable to secure an internship:

1. volunteer work: consider volunteering with a non-profit, community organization or social enterprise related to your field of study. this will give you practical experience and networking opportunities, and you will be contributing to society in a positive manner.

2. online courses: take online courses or certification programs to expand your knowledge and gain practical skills.

3. freelancing: consider freelancing in your field of study by offering your services to small businesses or startups. this can give you valuable experience and help you build your network.

4. join student organizations: join student organizations and clubs related to your field of study. these groups often host events and offer opportunities to connect with professionals in your field.

5. research projects: conduct research projects or participate in a research program within your university or course of study where you can develop practical skills and add value to your academic curriculum. 

6. attend conferences or seminars: attend conferences or seminars related to your field of study. this will give you an opportunity to learn from experts in your industry and network with professionals in your field. 

7. mentorship: find a mentor or network with other professionals in your industry to learn from their experiences and gain valuable insight into the industry you are interested in. 

it is important to remember that gaining experience in any field can take time and effort. don’t give up on pursuing your passions and continue seeking new opportunities to gain practical skills and knowledge.
